conclusion: Determine the acceleration of cargo A and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end.
Cargo A is initially at rest and placed on the conveyor moving at speed v0 = 2 m/s with kinetic friction coefficient mu1 = 0.2.
The force of kinetic friction acting on the cargo is Fk = mu1 * m * g.
The acceleration of cargo A is a = Fk/m = mu1 * g = 2 m/s^2.
Cargo will accelerate until it reaches speed v0 = 2 m/s using v = u + at.
Solving for t gives t = 1 s.
The distance traveled during acceleration is s = ut + 0.5 * at^2 = 1 m.
The total length of the conveyor is L1 = 6 m.
After reaching speed v0, the cargo travels remaining distance L2 = L1 - s = 5 m.
Time taken to travel remaining distance is t2 = L2/v0 = 2.5 s.
Total time taken is t_total = t1 + t2 = 3.5 s.
The acceleration of cargo A is 2 m/s^2 and total travel time is 3.5 s.
